snippet: The three Al Jazeera journalists, jailed on charges of fomenting unrest by broadcasting false images of civil strife, were being asked for $170,000 to see video footage in their case.
abstract: Egyptian court says three jailed Al Jazeera journalists must pay $170,000 for a copy of the video footage that prosecutors say shows the defendants fabricated news reports to foment unrest; all three have been in jail since December 2013 on charges that they had formed an Islamist cell and conspired with the Muslim Brotherhood, charges they deny.
lead_paragraph: The three Al Jazeera journalists, jailed on charges of fomenting unrest by broadcasting false images of civil strife, were being asked for $170,000 to see video footage in their case.

headline.main: Egypt Tells 3 They Must Pay to See Evidence
headline.print_headline: Egypt Tells 3 They Must Pay to See Evidence
